title: 109_hr5939
content:
The Act may be cited as the "Criminal Terrorism Improvements Act of 2006" and includes provisions related to terrorist offenses resulting in death. The "Criminal Terrorism Improvements Act of 2006" introduces a new offense under Chapter 113B of title 18, United States Code, called "Terrorist offenses resulting in death." This offense applies to individuals who, in the course of committing a terrorist offense, cause the death of a person. The punishment for this offense is death, imprisonment for any term of years, or life imprisonment. The term "terrorist offense" is defined to include specific felony offenses and attempts or conspiracies to commit these offenses. The "Criminal Terrorism Improvements Act of 2006" introduces a new offense under Chapter 113B of title 18, United States Code, called "Terrorist offenses resulting in death." This offense applies to individuals who cause the death of a person while committing a terrorist offense. The punishment can be death, imprisonment, or life imprisonment. A clerical amendment is made to the table of sections in the code. The "Criminal Terrorism Improvements Act of 2006" introduces a new offense called "Terrorist offenses resulting in death," which applies to individuals who cause a person's death while committing a terrorist offense. The punishment can be death, imprisonment, or life imprisonment. The "Criminal Terrorism Improvements Act of 2006" introduces amendments to various sections of the United States Code, allowing for the death penalty in cases involving nuclear threats, missile systems, atomic weapons, radiological dispersal devices, and the variola virus. SEC. 4. INCREASE IN CERTAIN PENALTIES.

    (a) Section 2332(b)(1) of title 18, United States Code, amended to increase penalty from 20 years to 30 years.
    (b) Section 2332(c) of title 18, United States Code, amended to increase penalty from ten years to 20 years.
    (c) Section 2339C(d) of title 18, United States Code, amended to increase penalties to 30 years and 20 years.

SEC. 5. MODERNIZATION OF STATE OF MIND REQUIREMENT FOR SECTION 2339C OFFENSES.

    Section 2339C of title 18, United States Code, amended to replace "unlawfully and wilfully" with "knowingly".

SEC. 6. PROVIDING MATERIAL SUPPORT TO TERRORIST GROUPS. SEC. 6 amends penalties for providing material support to terrorists, increasing minimum imprisonment to 10 years or life, and up to 30 years if death results. It also amends penalties for receiving military-type training from a foreign terrorist organization to 3-15 years. SEC. 7 amends Chapter 113B of title 18, United States Code to deny Federal benefits to individuals convicted of a Federal crime of terrorism. This includes ineligibility for any or all Federal benefits for a specified term or for life. SEC. 8 amends Section 2516(q) of title 18, US Code by updating wiretap predicates. SEC. 9 modifies Section 2339D by including attempts or conspiracies related to military training offenses.
